New Records: Yordan Alvarez became the second Astros player in history to hit at least 30 homers in four consecutive seasons.
Key Match Events: Yordan Alvarez hit his 29th and 30th homers of the season in the game against the Royals.
Jon Singleton hit a two-run homer in the fourth inning.
Ronel Blanco pitched five scoreless innings, walking four hitters and striking out three.
Post-Match Reflections: Yordan Alvarez expressed relief after hitting his first home run at home since June 22.
Astros manager Joe Espada praised the Royals and highlighted the Astros' improved performance since their earlier series in Kansas City.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros swept the four-game series against the Royals and have won five games in a row.
The Astros' 2.51 ERA in August was the best in the Major Leagues, and their .185 team opponents' batting average was the second lowest in any month by any team in Major League history.
